PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles N. Rickmond, 82 Lafferty Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that Negro communities actually choose their leaders or do they accept the leadership, which 'the powers-that-be' select and 'hand' to them?" answer reads: "I believe that the Negro community usually goes along with the people in power. The leaders are always selected by the powers-to-be, but the selections are good.  in past, the Afro-American League used to choose leaders, but they don't do it today."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles N. Rickmond wearing light colored fedora with dark band, dark scarf, and overcoat, standing in front of dark granite wall with shimmery flecks
